result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrek Gyrion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
Probation may be transferred to Taylor Co.
1 day credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Cases 14CF571 and 14CF574 called: 11:01am
State appears by ADA L.Leonhard.  Def appears in person and with Atty Dana Norgard.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

Waiver of Prelim. filed in 14CF574
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.

State moves to:
14CF571 - Ct. 1>>AMEND to Misd Retail Theft/PTAC pursuant to 943.50
14CF574 - Cts. 2 and 3>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
14CF571 - Ct. 1 (Misd Retail Theft/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST
14CF574 - Ct. 1 (Poss Methamphet)>>NO CONTEST
14CF574 - Ct. 4 (Poss Para)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty on 14CF571 Ct. 1 and 14CF574 Ct. 4 ONLY

COURT ORDERS: 14CF574 - Ct. 1>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 18 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND to Misd Poss of Controlled Substance with a recommended sentence of $5+CC
DEOJ RH>> 3/7/16 at 8:30am
Bond continues.

14CF571 Ct. 1 and 14CF574 Ct. 4>> Sentence W/held on both counts; 18 months Probation on each count concurrent
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC including 2 DNA surcharges; Absolute sobriety; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

>>In the event of revocation, defendant has 1 day credit on each count.
>>Defendant may transfer probation to Taylor County

Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for Day report program within 1 business day of release.   No contact with victim(s): Any Walmar or co-defendant(s): J.K. & R.J. 
Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
